title: 820-01700 PPBUS 5v
message:
Hello, I have this mac that was working, but stopped turning on unexpectedly. There was no contact with liquid.
It replaces the U7000, Q7030/40. 
C7030, R7030/40 are okay.

Voltage:
I removed F7000/01, in the PPVBAT_G3H_CHGR_REG mesh there is 12.33V.

In diode mode on the PPbus 0.275v

title: 820-01700 PPBUS 5v
message:
Do you get PPBUS_G3H voltage with F7000/1 soldered in place?
What about 3V3_G3H_RTC?
Did you test with 96/140W charger?
Also try with battery connected.

title: 820-01700 PPBUS 5v
message:
Without the F7000/1 fuse, it's 12.3V.
With the fuse it's 4.8V.

PP3V3_G3H_RTC_X 28mV | diode mode 0.390v

I'm using the original 96W charger.

title: 820-01700 PPBUS 5v
message:
PPBUS_G3H should give you higher value in diode mode to ground.
[URL unfurl="true"]https://openboarddata.org/?a=showboardsolutions&bpath=laptops/apple/820-01700[/URL]
Check it in reverse way too (black on ground).
Then check if any big coil gives you the same readings.
Don't forget the small coils for SSD (L9080/580).
